caption:
This photograph captures a serene, dimly lit forest scene dominated by rich, natural textures and a cool, blue-purple color tone. The primary focus is a group of pale mushrooms growing on the side of a dark, moss-covered tree trunk on the left side of the image. This focus on fungi adds a gentle contrast to the dark surroundings. The forest floor beneath the mushrooms is carpeted with a dense layer of rust-colored pine needles, interspersed with small patches of yellow and white lichens or mosses, adding some brightness to the dark soil.

In the background, the dark silhouettes of several slender tree trunks are visible, leaning at various angles and suggesting a dense, untamed forest. The darkness of the scene suggests it could be either twilight or an overcast day, which casts muted light and creates an atmosphere of quiet and solitude. The composition of the photograph, with its focus on the lower parts of the forest and the uniquely detailed, natural ground elements, conveys a sense of intimate closeness with the forest floor.
title: Forest ground cover of mushrooms, mosses, decaying fir, hemlock and cedar needles and the mold fungus that creates a rich mulch on the forest floor. Private forest preserve, Green Mountain, Washington near Seattle, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. November, 1974.
